content.text: Complete transcription of Seymour's school memories

text_sections.full_transcription:
I don't recall how many or their
names - My grandfather died at
an early age - I have one Brother
that was born MAY 4. 11- 19. -
I STARTED school when I was 6 Years old -
while in school I was a fairly good
student - until I graduated -
The Teachers I liked best was
Mr. Fox - Mr. FRANK, Mr. MILLERS
also My biology Teacher - Miss Rosenberg -
Mr Fox used to Yolked the class
TO IDEAS help to decide College
Dodgers Play - Mr. FRANK was
the SHOP TEACHER Mr. Millers was
the Science TEACHER -

[Page appears to continue but text is cut off]

HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_000027

insights: Cannot recall all siblings' names - memory issues
Grandfather died at 'early age' - family loss
One brother born May 4, 1919 (likely Mark's namesake)
Favorite teachers remembered by name decades later
Mr. Fox - discussed Brooklyn Dodgers with class
'TO IDEAS help to decide College' - confused phrasing
Brooklyn Dodgers mentioned again - important to identity
Working class education with shop/vocational focus
Cognitive decline evident in writing structure
forensic_notes: Brother born 1919 - 3 years younger than Seymour
Memory gaps about siblings despite earlier saying 8 children
Brooklyn Dodgers recurring theme - cultural touchstone
Shop class indicates vocational/trade education path
investigative_leads: Verify teachers: Fox, Frank, Millers, Rosenberg
Investigate vocational training programs in Brooklyn
